titleStmt.title: Description of Bryn Mawr College Libraries BV 71: Devotional book.

notesStmt.note: Customs stamp in Persian dated 1315 (1897 or 1898) (f. 97v).

msContents.summary: Devotional book containing selections from the Qurʼān, beginning with Sūrat Yūsuf and ending with a prayer. The entire text is written inside gilt pear-shapes with illuminated margins.
msContents.textLang: Arabic with one rubric in Persian

supportDesc.extent: iii, 98, i leaves : 120 x 70 (97 x 50) mm bound to 120 x 70 mm
supportDesc.foliation: Modern foliation added in pencil, upper left recto; catchwords each verso, lower left.

layoutDesc.layout: Written in 11 long lines; border-ruled in a pear-shape.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Written in naskh in black ink; pointed, vocalized.

decoDesc.decoNote: Each page gold frame-ruled with foliate fill, inside the frame is a gold bordered pear shape around the text. Between the frame and the border-rule is blue fill, more solidly colored at the bottom leading to vines and feathered finials at the top. Two openings have a wider gold border around the text with floral fill (f. 1v-2r, 60v-61r). Rubrications in red, including readings and titles. 4 unwritten pages, with the pear-shape outline present, at the end (f. 97r-98v).
Illuminated border-rules, fill and frame (every page)

binding.p: The text is disbound, the covers are thin reddish leather over pulpboard (Type III) with gilt stamped central mandorla and frame with floral fill between the central design and the frame and a different floral fill inside the frame itself. Inside covers are brown leather with gold tooled frame.

origin.p: Item is undated, perhaps written in the 18th or early 19th century.
